Operating Procedures [40 CFR Part 68.69]

To ensure safe operations, Barbasol maintains detailed written operating procedures.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations and normal shutdown.  The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

Employee Training [40 CFR Part 68.71]

Barbasol has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating plant processes are competent in the applicable operating procedures.  Refresher training is provided at least every three years and more frequently as needed.

Mechanical Integrity [40 CFR Part 68.73]

Barbasol carries out highly documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operations.  Inspected process equipment includes pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, pressure relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps.  Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in maintenance practices.  Furthermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed.  Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a timely manner.

Management of Change [MOC] [40 CFR Part 68.75]

Written procedures are in place at Barbasol to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and procedures.  Process operators, maintenance personnel or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and provided training to deal with the modification(s).

4.	Five-year Accident History [40 CFR Part 68.42]

Barbasol has an excellent record of preventing accidental releases since plant start up.  There has been no accidental release during this period.

5.	Emergency Response Plan [ERP] [40 CFR Part 68.95]

Pursuant to the requirements of 29 CFR 1910.38 and 40 CFR Part 68.95, Barbasol has a written ERP to address accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan includes all the applicable aspects of emergency response including evacuation, adequate first aid and medical treatment and notification of local emergency response agencies.
Our emergency response equipment is routinely inspected and serviced.  In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes to the covered processes that would require a modified emergency response.
Ashland County LEPC is the Local Emergency Planning Committee [LEPC] with which the ERP has been coordinated and verified.

6.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Implementation of the various elements of the RMP/PSM program has yielded lasting improvements.  Plant safety is continuously improved through employee suggestions, process engineering and equipment upgrades and hazard analyses.  These improvements are continuous and ongoing.

Compliance Audits [40 CFR Part 68.79]

Barbasol conducts compliance audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set under the RMP rule are being implemented.  These audits are conducted at least every 3 years and any corrective actions identified as a result of the audits are systematically completed in a  prompt manner.

Incident Investigation [40 CFR Part 68.81]

Barbasol promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in [Near Miss] a catastrophic release of a regulated substance.  These investigations are undertaken to identify the root cause(s) leading to the incident as well as corresponding corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring.  All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years.

Employee Participation [40 CFR Part 68.83]

Barbasol believes that Process Safety Management and accident prevention is a team effort.  Employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning safety and accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, the employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP and PSM rules, including information resulting from Process Hazard Analyses.

Contractor Safety Program [40 CFR Part 68.87]

Contractors are occasionally hired to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is carried out.  Barbasol has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards associated with the contractor's work and the corresponding processes. RMP - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Barbasol is strongly committed to environmental compliance, employee and public health and safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that encompasses design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training.  Robust engineering controls are in place to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.

2.	Regulated Substances Handled

The facility manufactures a variety of aerosol products.  Barbasol has 2 regulated substances above the 10,000 lbs threshold quantity at the facility, Isobutane and Propane, both flammable gases.  A mixture of 84.8% Isobutane and 15.2% Propane, called A-46, is received at the facility in typical 31,000 USG size railcars and transferred to an 18,000 USG size storage tank.  The A-46 mixture of Isobutane and Propane is used as an aerosol propellant in Barbasol products.

3.	General Accidental Release Prevention Program 

Barbasol has a program in place to comply with the provisions of the accidental release prevention regulations under 40 CFR Part 68.  This facility was designed and constructed in accordance with NFPA-58 Standards, 2004 Edition. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program.

Process Safety Information [40 CFR Part 68.65]

Barbasol maintains a detailed record of process safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all processes.

Process Hazard Analysis [40 CFR Part 68.67]

Comprehensive analyses ensure that hazards associated with the processes are identified and controlled efficiently.  The methodology used to conduct these analyses is What If/Checklist Combined and HAZOP.
